definition: gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
sighing voice, wailing breath (idiom)/to heave deep sighs/to sigh in despair

sentences.english: Mr. Lin heaved sigh after sigh. Mrs. Lin's hiccups were like a string of firecrackers .
sentences.chinese: 林先生常常嘆氣，林大娘的打嗝像連珠炮。

sentences.english: Then I sigh, deeply, and sit back into my chair.
sentences.chinese: 接着，我深深嘆氣，坐回到我的椅子上。

sentences.english: What parent stay for several days, moan and groan all day.
sentences.chinese: 何父住店多日，整日唉聲嘆氣。

sentences.english: Do we just sit there, sighing and complaining about it?
sentences.chinese: 難道我們就僅僅坐在這，唉聲嘆氣，抱怨嗎？

sentences.english: And I sigh with my punctuations.
"I was born in the wrong time, " he says, sighing.
Come on. Rabbit: Oh. No! You're too small.
sentences.chinese: 聽到小白兔的嘆氣聲，熱心的小狗又跑過來了。

sentences.english: Don't moan and groan because of a little setback.
sentences.chinese: 不要受了一點挫折就唉聲嘆氣。

sentences.english: He dramatizes his woes with sobs and sighs.
sentences.chinese: 他像演戲似地又哭泣又嘆氣，來表現他的痛苦。

sentences.english: Freezing briefly, the students erupted in moans.
sentences.chinese: 沉寂了片刻之後，學生們爆發出了嘆氣聲。

sentences.english: With one hand now always locked onto the handrail, I bemoaned and laughed about my predicament a little more.
sentences.chinese: 一隻手一直抓着欄杆，我邊嘆氣邊暗笑自己的推想。

sentences.english: Ginny's mom sighed and figured the bill hadn't been paid.
sentences.chinese: 金妮的媽媽嘆氣連連，猜想肯定是電話費沒交。

sentences.english: The night is dark. The brilliants are absent in clouds. The wind is buzz thasperous the lbump.
sentences.chinese: 夜是深黑的，星星消散在雲裏，風在葉叢中嘆氣。
他聽到一聲頗有同感的嘆氣聲。

sentences.english: The guests watched and winced in absolute silence.
sentences.chinese: 客人們看着事情的發展，搖頭嘆氣，鴉雀無聲。

sentences.english: Modified sigh is a kind of recruitment maneuvers.
sentences.chinese: 改良嘆氣法是肺復張的一種方法。

definition: at a loss to know what to do (idiom); bewildered
to swear while talking/to be foul-mouthed
lit. doesn't hurt, doesn't tickle (idiom); sth is wrong, but not quite sure what/fig. not getting to any matter of substance/scratching the surface/superficial/perfunctory
to act willfully and make a scene/to make trouble
to be disappointing/to fail to live up to expectations
to stomp or hop about (in anxiety, anger etc)/to dance on one's feet/hopping mad (anxious, etc)
